metadata.title: CVE-2016-1577 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in the jas_iccattrval_destroy function in JasPer1.900.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted ICC color profilein a JPEG 2000 image file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-8137.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1').
